author: Prakash Kumar NEW DELHI: Sep 26
title: NMML revamp plan to eclipse Nehru legacy
text:
NMML revamp plan to eclipse Nehru legacy Prakash Kumar NEW DELHI: Sep 26, 2015, DHNS: The Narendra Modi government may not make less of Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru’s legacy preserved at the Nehru Memorial Museum and Library (NMML) but virtually eclipse it with the legacies of Mahatma Gandhi, Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel, Subhash Chandra Bose and many other contemporary leaders.
Vice chairman of the NMML’s executive committee and BJP Rajya Sabha MP M J Akbar has proposed to allocate some of the rooms at the memorial to showcase contributions of Mahatma Gandhi, Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel, Subhash Chandra Bose, B R Ambedkar, Maulana Azad and other leaders.
The “new design plan” for NMML revamp, suggested by Akbar, is being examined by the Union Culture Ministry.
According to the proposed plan, an exhibition can be put up in one of the rooms on the ground floor of main memorial building to show case challenges that the Interim Government of India faced during 1946-47, stories of crisis management in the wake of riots and killings in Noakhali, Bihar, Delhi and in Bengal, Gandhiji and Nehru working together for peace.
In the same room, exhibitions on integration of princely states with the Indian Union has also been proposed with depictions how Patel and Nehru held things in place “in a world fresh from ruins of war, mass violence.”
To showcase “challenges to India’s unity”, Akbar has proposed setting up of exhibitions in two rooms on the first floor of the building to highlight contributions of Patel in achieving amalgamation of princely states Hyderabad and Kashmir into India.
These rooms can also have exhibitions on reorganisation of linguistic states; separatism, Insurgency, statehood in Nagaland, Liberation of Goa, among other things, as proposed by the NMML vice chairman.
One of the rooms on the ground floor of the building has been proposed to be allocated for showcasing celebration of India’s freedom from colonial rule.
Under the theme ‘15th August 1947 – Gandhiji in Calcutta’, exhibitions may be put up depicting the Father of the Nation trying to save lives by offering his own as “a man who saw August 15 as failure rather than triumph.”
In the same room, Patel, Bose, Azad and other “heroes of 1947” as well as members of the first cabinet of the government of India can also be exhibited, Akbar proposed .
One of the rooms on the ground floor may showcase making of the Constitution of India under the theme “Democracy: Foundational Moment”.
This may include display of the Constitution (1950) along with picture of the Constitution page border designed by Nandlal Bose as well as picture of the father of Constitution Ambedkar.
The exhibition room may also have world’s largest electoral roll by September 1949 on display and glimpses of elections in India in 1951-52, among other things. However, the museum, which may also have exhibitions on Buddha as heritage, will continue to showcase life and contributions of Nehru too in many of the rooms in the NMML main building from the days of his childhood in Anand Bhawan, according to the proposed plan.
